pages.text:
The Team
Home
»
About
»
The Team
Karen Corbin
Executive Director
Karen@RealizeBradenton.com
Realize Bradenton Executive Director Karen Corbin has been advancing the organization’s mission since she began as the Development Director in 2019. In 2022, Karen assumed the position of Executive Director and brings her experience in management, development, and building partnerships to her role.
Learn more about Karen
Karen’s previous work has equipped her with the skills needed to lead Realize Bradenton through the leadership transition and into the future of the organization.
Prior to bringing her talents to Realize Bradenton, Karen has worked in leadership roles in education and healthcare with the National Kidney Foundation, Juvenile Diabetes Foundation, Chase Collegiate School, National Multiple Sclerosis Society.
Andrea Knies
Director of Communications & Community Engagement
Andrea@RealizeBradenton.com
Andrea joined the Realize Bradenton team in 2020 and brings experience, education, and dedication to her role. She is a natural in this position since she naturally promotes The Friendly City in all she does.
Learn more about Andrea
Prior to working at Realize Bradenton, she worked for the Arts and Cultural Alliance of Sarasota County, New College of Florida, and Gallup. Andrea is also an active member of the Central West Coast Chapter of the Florida Public Relations Association and has served on that board for five years.
Andrea is Accredited in Public Relations (APR), a national designation that demonstrates personal drive, professional acumen, a commitment to ethics, and dedication to lifelong learning. She has also earned a Bachelor’s degree with dual majors in Communication and Sociology and a Master’s degree from Indiana University.
In addition, she is an avid fan of local history and has written Vigilance, a novel based on an event in local history, co-owns Compass Rose History Experiences, and serves as the Vice President for Friends of Manatee Village. She is also a graduate of Leadership Manatee Class 34 (with Cindy)!
Cindy Winning
Office Manager
Accounting@RealizeBradenton.com
Cindy began working with Realize Bradenton in 2023 and brings experience working closely with our local community to her role. Her commitment to community is seen through her passion for the Realize Bradenton mission.
Learn more about Cindy
Prior to working with Realize Bradenton, Cindy was active in the community through her 10 years of experience with the SunCoast Blood Centers. At SunCoast Blood Centers she served as the Senior Donor Group Representative and a Speaker. She advocated for the importance of blood donation and coordinated blood drives throughout the community. Prior to calling Florida home, Cindy lived in Virginia where she worked for Northwest Design/Build/Renovate as a Managing Partner and as a designer at Kitchen Works.
Cindy is currently involved in the Bradenton Woman’s Club and a proud member of Leadership Manatee Class 34 (with Andrea)! She is a compassionate person who has spent over 15 years volunteering with Big Brothers Big Sisters and Senior Visitors in Virginia and has been an advocate and caregiver for Alzheimer patients.
Jodi Carroll
Director of Operations
Jodi@RealizeBradenton.com
Jodi has been a valued member of the Realize Bradenton team since 2015. Her extensive background in parks and recreation departments has equipped her with exceptional skills in leadership, fundraising, and strategic planning.
Learn more about Jodi
Jodi spent 24 years with Rockford Park District in Illinois as Deputy Director of Recreation Services. In this role she oversaw 350 employees and a $10 million operating budget as she worked with revenue facilities, internal support departments, and coordinated the Art in Public Places Public Art Committee.
After relocating to Florida she worked with the Friends of Sarasota County Parks and currently volunteers in her neighborhood by serving on the Waterlefe Golf and River Club MPOA Board of Directors. Jodi holds a Bachelor of Arts in Management and Communications from Concordia University in Mequon, Wisconsin.
Kristie Kindstrom
Events Manager
Kristie@RealizeBradenton.com
Kristie began working with Realize Bradenton in January of 2021 when she took on the role of coordinating our new entrepreneurship program, the Start-Up Circle. Since then, she has continued to become more involved in the organization and became our Events Manager in 2023.
Learn more about Kristie
Kristie’s ability to bring people together can be seen throughout her 30 years of experience in financial services where, as Vice President of Wealth Management, she managed teams of financial and wealth managers. She is a Certified Senior Advisor and currently runs her own business dedicated to preparing people for life’s interruptions. Kristie is also devoted to the American Heart Association and over the last decade has been a corporate lead, a team captain, and served on the Suncoast Heart Walk Executive Leadership Committee. If Kristie looks familiar, you might have seen her as a speaker at TedX Bradenton!
Heather Empsall
Market Manager
Heather@RealizeBradenton.com
Since Heather started leading the Bradenton Market in 2021, the Market’s vendors and attendance have more than doubled. Her positive attitude and attention to detail have made Bradenton a must-see destination!
Learn more about Heather
Even though Heather first joined us in 2021, she’s no stranger to the Market world. Prior to coming to Bradenton, she spent over eight years in a variety of roles at the Sarasota Farmers Market and learned all of the skills – from vendor management to marketing –  that are required to make a Market thrive.
In addition to her work at the Market, Heather is passionate about uplifting and empowering area youth. She created the Youth Booth program at the Market,  is actively involved on the Advisory Council for Healthy Teens, and has volunteered as the Room Parent in our local elementary schools.
P.O. Box 9114
Bradenton, FL 34206
Info@RealizeBradenton.com
Voicemail: (941) 301-8445

Support
Home
»
Support
Donate
Realize Bradenton donors demonstrate their confidence in our impact and outstanding results.
Your contribution
allows us to continue our work supporting entrepreneurs, providing free, family-friendly events, and realizing the possibilities of Bradenton.
Our Sponsors
Our sponsors
are Realize Bradenton partners who help us promote the region in engaging ways that also showcase the sponsor’s business and community contributions. These businesses and individual donors are recognized as civic leaders and receive exceptional exposure within the community.
Please contact Karen Corbin if you are interested in becoming a Realize Bradenton Sponsor:
Karen@realizebradenton.com
.
Subscribe
Learn more about Realize Bradenton and what is happening downtown through our
monthly newsletter
.

Events
Home
»
Events
BAM!Fest
On Saturday, April 5, 2025 from 11 am – 7 pm
BAM!Fest
(Bradenton Art & Music Festival) will transform the Riverwalk into a dynamic, diverse, immersive art and music experience from bridge to bridge!
Winter Wonderland
Winter Wonderland
transforms Bradenton’s Old Main Street into a seasonal celebration with fun for the entire family. Enjoy performances from local students, local vendors, and Santa. Join us on
Saturday, December 14th from 5:00 – 8:30 pm on Old Main Street
in Bradenton.
Music in the Park
Music in the Park
is a free, family-friendly music series featuring local musicians. These outdoor concerts are held on Fridays in October and April at the Bradenton Riverwalk Pavilion.
Start-Up Circle
The
Start-Up Circle
is a free business and project planning course designed for aspiring and newly established entrepreneurs. Classes are taught by local experts and cover the basics of starting or bolstering an independent business – from licensing to financial literacy, market research to cash flow and more.
Submit An Event
Do you have an event that you would like to add to the calendar? Please submit it to our partner organization, Discover Bradenton, for consideration.
Submit An Event

About
Home
»
About
Our Mission
We enhance the vibrancy of downtown Bradenton through community engagement, events, and the pursuit of insightful and innovative practices to increase social connectivity.
The Team
We work hard to make a difference in our community every day, and strive to be great at what we do (while having fun at the same time). Heartfelt appreciation to sponsors, donors, volunteers, and partners, because they make our work possible. Meet
our team
.
The Board
Our board members apply multi-generations of experience, knowledge, tenacity, and dedication. We are also passionate about the Bradenton area and its future. Meet our
Board members
.
Our History
Realize Bradenton was founded in 2010 to implement elements from Bradenton’s 2009 Cultural Master Plan.
Since its founding, Realize Bradenton’s accomplishments include: collecting community input for the development of the Riverwalk Park and the recent Riverwalk East expansion, growing the Bradenton Farmers’ Market (now known as the
Bradenton Market
), creating the Bradenton Blues Festival, increasing public art, and the recent addition of the
Start-Up Circle
entrepreneur program.

BAM!Fest
On Saturday, April 5, 2025 from 11 am – 7 pm
BAM!Fest
(Bradenton Art & Music Festival) will transform the Riverwalk into a dynamic, diverse, immersive art and music experience from bridge to bridge!
Winter Wonderland
Winter Wonderland
transforms Bradenton’s Old Main Street into a seasonal celebration with fun for the entire family. Enjoy performances from local students, local vendors, and Santa. Join us on
Saturday, December 14th from 5:00 – 8:30 pm on Old Main Street
in Bradenton.
Music in the Park
Music in the Park
is a free, family-friendly music series featuring local musicians. These outdoor concerts are held on Fridays in October and April at the Bradenton Riverwalk Pavilion.
Start-Up Circle
The
Start-Up Circle
is a free business and project planning course designed for aspiring and newly established entrepreneurs. Classes are taught by local experts and cover the basics of starting or bolstering an independent business – from licensing to financial literacy, market research to cash flow and more.
Submit An Event
Do you have an event that you would like to add to the calendar? Please submit it to our partner organization, Discover Bradenton, for consideration.
Submit An Event

The Team
Karen Corbin
Executive Director
Karen@RealizeBradenton.com
Realize Bradenton Executive Director Karen Corbin has been advancing the organization’s mission since she began as the Development Director in 2019. In 2022, Karen assumed the position of Executive Director and brings her experience in management, development, and building partnerships to her role.
Learn more about Karen
Karen’s previous work has equipped her with the skills needed to lead Realize Bradenton through the leadership transition and into the future of the organization.
Prior to bringing her talents to Realize Bradenton, Karen has worked in leadership roles in education and healthcare with the National Kidney Foundation, Juvenile Diabetes Foundation, Chase Collegiate School, National Multiple Sclerosis Society.
Andrea Knies
Director of Communications & Community Engagement
Andrea@RealizeBradenton.com
Andrea joined the Realize Bradenton team in 2020 and brings experience, education, and dedication to her role. She is a natural in this position since she naturally promotes The Friendly City in all she does.
Learn more about Andrea
Prior to working at Realize Bradenton, she worked for the Arts and Cultural Alliance of Sarasota County, New College of Florida, and Gallup. Andrea is also an active member of the Central West Coast Chapter of the Florida Public Relations Association and has served on that board for five years.
Andrea is Accredited in Public Relations (APR), a national designation that demonstrates personal drive, professional acumen, a commitment to ethics, and dedication to lifelong learning. She has also earned a Bachelor’s degree with dual majors in Communication and Sociology and a Master’s degree from Indiana University.
In addition, she is an avid fan of local history and has written Vigilance, a novel based on an event in local history, co-owns Compass Rose History Experiences, and serves as the Vice President for Friends of Manatee Village. She is also a graduate of Leadership Manatee Class 34 (with Cindy)!
Cindy Winning
Office Manager
Accounting@RealizeBradenton.com
Cindy began working with Realize Bradenton in 2023 and brings experience working closely with our local community to her role. Her commitment to community is seen through her passion for the Realize Bradenton mission.
Learn more about Cindy
Prior to working with Realize Bradenton, Cindy was active in the community through her 10 years of experience with the SunCoast Blood Centers. At SunCoast Blood Centers she served as the Senior Donor Group Representative and a Speaker. She advocated for the importance of blood donation and coordinated blood drives throughout the community. Prior to calling Florida home, Cindy lived in Virginia where she worked for Northwest Design/Build/Renovate as a Managing Partner and as a designer at Kitchen Works.
Cindy is currently involved in the Bradenton Woman’s Club and a proud member of Leadership Manatee Class 34 (with Andrea)! She is a compassionate person who has spent over 15 years volunteering with Big Brothers Big Sisters and Senior Visitors in Virginia and has been an advocate and caregiver for Alzheimer patients.
Jodi Carroll
Director of Operations
Jodi@RealizeBradenton.com
Jodi has been a valued member of the Realize Bradenton team since 2015. Her extensive background in parks and recreation departments has equipped her with exceptional skills in leadership, fundraising, and strategic planning.
Learn more about Jodi
Jodi spent 24 years with Rockford Park District in Illinois as Deputy Director of Recreation Services. In this role she oversaw 350 employees and a $10 million operating budget as she worked with revenue facilities, internal support departments, and coordinated the Art in Public Places Public Art Committee.
After relocating to Florida she worked with the Friends of Sarasota County Parks and currently volunteers in her neighborhood by serving on the Waterlefe Golf and River Club MPOA Board of Directors. Jodi holds a Bachelor of Arts in Management and Communications from Concordia University in Mequon, Wisconsin.
Kristie Kindstrom
Events Manager
Kristie@RealizeBradenton.com
Kristie began working with Realize Bradenton in January of 2021 when she took on the role of coordinating our new entrepreneurship program, the Start-Up Circle. Since then, she has continued to become more involved in the organization and became our Events Manager in 2023.
Learn more about Kristie
Kristie’s ability to bring people together can be seen throughout her 30 years of experience in financial services where, as Vice President of Wealth Management, she managed teams of financial and wealth managers. She is a Certified Senior Advisor and currently runs her own business dedicated to preparing people for life’s interruptions. Kristie is also devoted to the American Heart Association and over the last decade has been a corporate lead, a team captain, and served on the Suncoast Heart Walk Executive Leadership Committee. If Kristie looks familiar, you might have seen her as a speaker at TedX Bradenton!
Heather Empsall
Market Manager
Heather@RealizeBradenton.com
Since Heather started leading the Bradenton Market in 2021, the Market’s vendors and attendance have more than doubled. Her positive attitude and attention to detail have made Bradenton a must-see destination!
Learn more about Heather
Even though Heather first joined us in 2021, she’s no stranger to the Market world. Prior to coming to Bradenton, she spent over eight years in a variety of roles at the Sarasota Farmers Market and learned all of the skills – from vendor management to marketing –  that are required to make a Market thrive.
In addition to her work at the Market, Heather is passionate about uplifting and empowering area youth. She created the Youth Booth program at the Market,  is actively involved on the Advisory Council for Healthy Teens, and has volunteered as the Room Parent in our local elementary schools.

Bradenton, FL 34206
